thread.title: Man lit bushfires with young children in the car, police allege
thread.title_full: Man lit bushfires with young children in the car, police allege

author: Dan Proudman
title: Man lit bushfires with young children in the car, police allege
text:
Man lit bushfires with young children in the car, police allege Dan Proudman twitter TWEET More 
A former volunteer firefighter stands accused of sparking two bushfires about four kilometres apart while he had two young children with him. 
Authorities allege the fires, lit on Dargavilles Road near Nabiac during Sunday's heatwave, were extinguished before completely taking hold after witnesses saw the man's white van leave the scene moments before smoke began to pour skyward. 85 bushfires continue to burn in NSW 85 bushfires continue to burn in NSW 
23 uncontained bushfires are part of the 85 that firefighters continue to battle, as fires in Leadville and Kains Flat remain on Watch and Act level. Vision: Seven News. Up Next Renewable blame game Renewable blame game 
The Liberal Party has been accused by Labor of lying about the reason for South Australia's blackouts by blaming renewable energy, something Malcolm Turnbull rejects. Courtesy ABC News 24. Up Next Wild weather continues across Australia Play Video Wild weather continues across Australia Wild weather continues across Australia 
Four of the Queensland's towns recorded the hottest temperatures in history on Saturday while West Australia is battling a flood crisis. (Video courtesy: Seven News) Up Next What makes a great teacher? Play Video What makes a great teacher? What makes a great teacher? 
Everyone has met one, but what does it really take to provide the perfect learning environment? We asked an expert. Up Next Preferences for Pauline angers Joyce Play Video Preferences for Pauline angers Joyce Preferences for Pauline angers Joyce 
Deputy PM Barnaby Joyce isn't happy the WA Liberal Party is preferencing One Nation over the Nationals but Pauline Hanson says her party is a force that can't be ignored. Up Next 12 homes lost to NSW bushfires Play Video 12 homes lost to NSW bushfires 12 homes lost to NSW bushfires 
More than 40,000 hectares and at least 12 homes have been destroyed, but no loss of life reported, in NSWâs worst ever fire day. Up Next Gang storms Summersault music festival Play Video Gang storms Summersault music festival Gang storms Summersault music festival 
Dozens of young men run through Melbourne's Summersault festival, stealing mobile phones and assaulting festival-goers. Vision courtesy Seven News Melbourne. More videos 85 bushfires continue to burn in NSW 
23 uncontained bushfires are part of the 85 that firefighters continue to battle, as fires in Leadville and Kains Flat remain on Watch and Act level. Vision: Seven News. 
Nearby police patrolled other rural roads in the area before seeing the suspect vehicle and taking the 32-year-old into custody. 
It is alleged the man had two children - both aged under 10 - with him when he stopped on the side of the road and used a cigarette lighter to spark the first fire. Related Content 'Leave now': Fire breaches containment lines, residents told to get out 
He then allegedly drove several kilometres along the road before stopping and repeating the act. 
Firefighters were able to contain both blazes to about three hectares despite the extreme fire danger across the region. Advertisement 
The suspect is understood to have been a Rural Fire Service member before resigning in 2007. 
He was charged on Sunday with two counts of intentionally cause fire and be reckless as to its spread and refused bail to appear in Taree Local Court on Monday. SHARE
